title: The root schema
description: The root schema comprises the entire JSON document.

deployment.title: The deployment schema
deployment.description: Configuration of the Connaisseur Kubernetes deployment.

replicasCount.title: The replicasCount schema
replicasCount.description: The number of replicas of Connaisseur deployment. (https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/deployment/#creating-a-deployment)

imagePullPolicy.title: The imagePullPolicy schema
imagePullPolicy.description: The Image Pull Policy of Connaisseur container. (https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/#image-pull-policy)

imagePullSecrets.title: The imagePullSecrets schema
imagePullSecrets.description: The list of ImagePullSecrets of Connaisseur if pulling from a private registry. (https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/pull-image-private-registry/)

items.title: The ImagePullSecret schema
items.description: An ImagePullSecret of Connaisseur if pulling from a private registry.

name.title: The name schema
name.description: Name of Kubernetes Secret to use for authentication with private registry.

failurePolicy.title: The failurePolicy schema
failurePolicy.description: The failure policy of Connaisseur webhook. (https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/extensible-admission-controllers/#failure-policy)

enabled.title: The enabled schema
enabled.description: Whether Connaisseur pod should be assigned a PSP.

name.title: The name schema
name.description: List of names of the PSPs to be applied to Connaisseur pod.

envs.title: The envs schema
envs.description: Additional environment variables used for autentication to KMS providers with Cosign validator.

extraContainers.title: The extraContainers schema
extraContainers.description: Extra containers to be injected into the Connaisseur Pod to be used as sidecar.

extraVolumes.title: The extraVolumes schema
extraVolumes.description: Extra volumes to be added to the Connaisseur Pod.

extraVolumeMounts.title: The extraVolumeMounts schema
extraVolumeMounts.description: Extra volume mounts of the Connaisseur Pod.

service.title: The service schema
service.description: Configuration of the Connaisseur Kubernetes service resource.

validators.title: The validators schema
validators.description: The different methods how to validate a container image.

items.title: The validators schema
items.description: The different methods how to validate a container image.

type.title: The type schema
type.description: Type of the validator. Currently supported types are notaryv1, cosign and static.

host.title: The host schema
host.description: Host name of the notary instance.

trust_roots.title: The trust_roots schema
trust_roots.description: The trust root of this validator. Currently, only public keys are supported as trust roots, but there may come other kinds of trust roots (e.g. mail addresses with OIDC flow).

key.title: The trust root's key schema.
key.description: Public key used for verification of signatures on container images whose policy matches this trust root.

is_acr.title: The is_acr schema
is_acr.description: Indicates whether the notary V1 instance is attached to an ACR (Azure Container Registry) as this requires slight adaptions in communication with the notary instance.

cert.title: The cert schema
cert.description: TLS certificate if using a notary V1 instance requiring a self-signed certificate.

auth.title: The auth schema
auth.description: Authentication credentials if using a private notary V1 instance.

username.title: The auth username schema
username.description: Username required for authentication with notary V1 instance.

password.title: The auth password schema
password.description: Password required for authentication with notary V1 instance.

secret.title: The auth secret schema
secret.description: Name of a Kubernetes secret containing authentication credentials.

anyOf.title: The second anyOf schema
anyOf.description: A notary V2 validator instance. This validator is not functional at this point of time and just reserved for future use.

trust_roots.title: The trust_roots schema for cosign validator
trust_roots.description: The trust root of the cosign validator. Currently, only public keys are supported as trust roots, but there may come other kinds of trust roots (e.g. mail addresses with OIDC flow).

key.title: The trust root's key schema.
key.description: Public key used for verification of signatures on container images whose policy matches this trust root.

cert.title: The cert schema
cert.description: TLS certificate if using a registry requiring a self-signed certificate.

auth.title: Authentication credentials if using a private registry instance.

secret.title: The auth secret schema
secret.description: Name of a Kubernetes secret containing authentication credentials.

anyOf.title: The fourth anyOf schema
anyOf.description: A static validator instance either allowing or disallowing images regardless of any signature or content.

approve.title: The approve schema for static validator
approve.description: Indicates whether the validator should allow or deny all container images matching this policy.

policy.title: The policy schema
policy.description: Policy to configure mappings of previously configured validators to matching container images.

pattern.title: The pattern schema
pattern.description: The image name of the admission request will be matched against this pattern using unix filename pattern matching.

validator.title: The validator schema
validator.description: Name of a previously defined validator. Must match the `name` key of the validator.

with.title: The with schema
with.description: Specifies the exact validation technique. Currently, only trust_root objects are supported.

trust_root.title: The trust_root schema
trust_root.description: The trust root (key) to use. Must match the `name` key of an entry in the validator's `trust_roots` list.

detectionMode.title: The detectionMode schema
detectionMode.description: Enables turning on detection mode such that images are not actually denied, but instead only warnings are issued.

namespacedValidation.title: The namespacedValidation schema
namespacedValidation.description: Allows restricting Connaisseur to selected namespaces only (either by selecting or deselecting namespaces for Connaisseur).

enabled.title: The enabled schema
enabled.description: Indicates whether namespaced validation is enabled or not.

mode.title: The mode schema
mode.description: `ignore` mode will validate all namespaces NOT having the `securesystemsengineering.connaisseur/webhook=ignore` label while `validate` will validate all namespaces having the `securesystemsengineering.connaisseur/webhook=validate` label.

automaticChildApproval.title: The automaticChildApproval schema
automaticChildApproval.description: AutomaticChildApproval will allow all workload objects with coinciding images belonging to the same parent resource.

enabled.title: The enabled schema
enabled.description: Whether automaticChildApproval is enabled or not.

debug.title: The debug schema
debug.description: Sets the log level to 'debug' which allows for more detailed information in the logs.

logLevel.title: The logLevel schema
logLevel.description: The logLevel option allows configuring the log level.

alerting.title: The alerting schema
alerting.description: The alerting subblock allows linkage to third party entities receiving JSON-formatted POST requests as Connaisseur alerts.

cluster_identifier.title: The cluster_identifier schema
cluster_identifier.description: Name or identifier of the cluster such that the alert can be linked. If not specified, the alerts will show 'not specified' as cluster identifier.

admit_request.title: The admit_request schema
admit_request.description: Configuration for alerts to be sent when an admission request has been admitted.

templates.title: The templates schema
templates.description: Specifies a list of alert templates to use in case of admitted images.

anyOf.title: The first anyOf schema
anyOf.description: Configuration of alert depending on the receiving entity.

template.title: The template schema
template.description: Template to render an alert specific to the receiving entity. Value must be chosen such that <template>.json matches one of the file names in the ./alert_payload_templates directory.

receiver_url.title: The receiver_url schema
receiver_url.description: The endpoint receiving the rendered JSON template as POST request.

priority.title: The priority schema
priority.description: Integer to indicate priority of the alert.

custom_headers.title: The custom_headers schema
custom_headers.description: Custom headers to be sent along with the JSON payload.

anyOf.title: The first anyOf schema
anyOf.description: Custom request headers specified as strings. OpsGenie requires the Authorization header containing the GenieKey.

payload_fields.title: The payload_fields schema
payload_fields.description: Object to be converted into JSON to amend the rendered Connaisseur alert JSON. Especially for OpsGenie alerts. (OpsGenie docs about available fields: https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/alert-api#create-alert.)

fail_if_alert_sending_fails.title: The fail_if_alert_sending_fails schema
fail_if_alert_sending_fails.description: If set, throws an error if an alert cannot be sent.

reject_request.title: The reject_request schema
reject_request.description: Configuration for alerts to be sent when an admission request has been admitted.

templates.title: The templates schema
templates.description: Specifies a list of alert templates to use in case of admitted images.

anyOf.description: Configuration of alert depending on the receiving entity.

template.description: Template to render an alert specific to the receiving entity. Value must be chosen such that <template>.json matches one of the file names in the ./alert_payload_templates directory.

receiver_url.description: The endpoint receiving the rendered JSON template as POST request.

priority.title: The priority schema

custom_headers.title: The custom_headers schema
custom_headers.description: Custom headers to be sent along with the JSON payload.

anyOf.description: Custom request headers specified as strings. OpsGenie requires the Authorization header containing the GenieKey.

payload_fields.title: The payload_fields schema
payload_fields.description: Object to be converted into JSON to amend the rendered Connaisseur alert JSON. Especially for OpsGenie alerts. (OpsGenie docs about available fields: https://docs.opsgenie.com/docs/alert-api#create-alert.)

fail_if_alert_sending_fails.description: If set, throws an error if an alert cannot be sent.
